clusters.title: Live: Zelensky to meet Trump for talks on Ukraine peace plan
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelenskyy heads to Florida for talks with Trump amid fresh strikes on Kyiv

items.title: Live: Zelensky to meet Trump for talks on Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump will meet his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, in Florida on Sunday for talks on a peace agreement to end the nearly four-year war with Russia. This comes as Moscow's Foreign ​Minister Sergei Lavrov said that any ‍European ​troops deployed ⁠to Ukraine would become legitimate targets for ​Russia’s armed ‍forces, according to state news agency TASS. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump will meet his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, in Florida on Sunday for talks on a peace agreement to end the nearly four-year war with Russia. This comes as Moscow's Foreign ​Minister Sergei Lavrov said that any ‍European ​troops deployed ⁠to Ukraine would become legitimate targets for ​Russia’s armed ‍forces, according to state news agency TASS. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Zelenskyy heads to Florida for talks with Trump amid fresh strikes on Kyiv
items.standfirst: Attacks leave hundreds of thousands without heating as Ukrainian leader readies for intense weekend of diplomacyA third of Kyiv is without heating after a Russian drone and missile barrage on the Ukrainian capital cut off power supplies, leaving hundreds of thousands of people facing freezing temperatures.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said Moscow had used nearly 500 drones and 40 missiles, including ballistic missiles, in the overnight attack. “The primary target is Kyiv – energy facilities and civilian infrastructure,” he said in a post on X. Continue reading...

items.content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is set to meet Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday for further talks aimed at ending Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

items.title: Russia pummels Kyiv ahead of Zelensky-Trump meeting
items.standfirst: Russia pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles on Saturday, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelensky's latest talks with US leader Donald Trump. Zelensky said Russia’s attack on Ukraine shows that Russia does “not want to end the war”. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert gives us his analysis.
items.content: Russia pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles on Saturday, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelensky's latest talks with US leader Donald Trump. Zelensky said Russia’s attack on Ukraine shows that Russia does “not want to end the war”. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert gives us his analysis.

items.title: Russian drones, missiles pound Ukraine ahead of Zelensky's US visit
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine with missiles and drones on Saturday (December 27), ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelensky said ⁠would be a crucial meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to work out a plan to end nearly four years of war.
items.content: Russia attacked Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine with missiles and drones on Saturday (December 27), ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelensky said ⁠would be a crucial meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to work out a plan to end nearly four years of war.

items.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-U.S. talks
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.
items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is en route to the U.S. via Canada ahead of a weekend of high-stakes diplomacy and a renewed push for peace amid deadly Russian bombing on Ukraine’s capital

clusters.title: More countries reject Israel's recognition of Somaliland
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland criticized across world capitals

items.title: More countries reject Israel's recognition of Somaliland
Israel criticised after becoming first country to formally recognise Somaliland as independent nation
items.standfirst: Israel has been criticised after it became the first country to formally recognise Somalia's breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation.
items.content: Israel has been criticised after it became the first country to formally recognise Somalia's breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation.

items.title: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland slammed across world capitals
items.standfirst: Regional blocs join nations in condemning Israel's move to formally recognise breakaway Somali region as independent.
items.content: Regional blocs join nations in condemning Israel's move to formally recognise breakaway Somali region as independent.

items.title: Somalia denounces Israeli recognition of Somaliland
items.standfirst: Somalia reacted angrily Friday (December 26) after Israel formally recognised the northern region of Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" – the first country to do so. Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, has for decades pushed for international recognition. US President Donald Trump said he opposed US recognition of Somaliland in an interview with the New York Post.
items.content: Somalia reacted angrily Friday (December 26) after Israel formally recognised the northern region of Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" – the first country to do so. Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, has for decades pushed for international recognition. US President Donald Trump said he opposed US recognition of Somaliland in an interview with the New York Post.

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
items.standfirst: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...
items.content: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

items.content: The US president says air strikes are against ISIL, claiming the group targets Christians.

items.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.
items.content: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.

items.title: US air strikes in Nigeria targeted IS group fighters trying to enter from Sahel, govt says
items.standfirst: US-backed air strikes in Nigeria targeted Islamic State group fighters who were attempting to enter the country from the Sahel region, according to the Nigerian government. US President Donald Trump said on his social media platform that the strikes were carried out on Thursday at the request of Nigeria's government, and that the group had been targeting Christians in the region.
items.content: US-backed air strikes in Nigeria targeted Islamic State group fighters who were attempting to enter the country from the Sahel region, according to the Nigerian government. US President Donald Trump said on his social media platform that the strikes were carried out on Thursday at the request of Nigeria's government, and that the group had been targeting Christians in the region.

items.title: Department of Defense video shows a missile being launched after Nigeria strikes
items.standfirst: The United States carried out strikes against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, U.S. President Donald Trump and the U.S. military said.
items.content: The United States carried out strikes against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, U.S. President Donald Trump and the U.S. military said.

clusters.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak sentenced to 15 more years in landmark corruption case
clusters.neutral_headline: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak sentenced to 15 more years in landmark corruption case
items.standfirst: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday (December 26) after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.
items.content: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday (December 26) after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal
items.standfirst: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...
items.content: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...

items.content: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

items.title: Bulgaria prepares to join eurozone amid fears of Russian-backed disinformation
items.standfirst: Balkan country will become 21st country to adopt EU currency, with policymakers hoping move will boost economy Bulgaria is preparing to adopt the euro in January amid fresh domestic political turbulence and fears that Russia-aligned disinformation is deepening distrust of the new currency.The Balkan country of 6.5 million people will become the 21st country to join the eurozone on 1 January, as policymakers in Brussels and Sofia hope it will boost the economy of the EU’s poorest nation and cement its pro-western trajectory. items.title: Patel says FBI headquarters to ‘permanently close’ with move
items.standfirst: FBI Director Kash Patel said the agency’s historic-but-aging headquarters in Washington would be “shut down permanently” as he shifts personnel into the building once occupied by the now-defunct U.S. Agency for International Development. “After more than 20 years of failed attempts, we finalized a…

items.title: FBI to move out of brutalist J Edgar Hoover building in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Iconic building, called ‘greatest monstrosity ever constructed’ by Hoover himself, to be closed downThe FBI director, Kash Patel, said the law enforcement agency’s sprawling but ageing J Edgar Hoover building in Washington DC will be closed down and the agency will move into existing offices elsewhere.Some FBI workers will report to the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center in the US capital to occupy the former offices of the US Agency for International Development, which was dismantled by the Trump administration earlier this year. Continue reading...

items.title: Equal pay settlements for female council workers pass £1bn
items.standfirst: GMB union says 30,000 claims settled with six local councils for average of £30,000 and expects 10,000 more in 2026Equal pay settlements for female workers at local councils have passed the £1bn mark, with thousands more expected next year.Legal claims have been brought against local councils on behalf of people in female-dominated roles, such as cleaners or carers, who for years have been denied the conditions and benefits given to employees in traditionally male-dominated jobs. Continue reading...

items.title: FaZe Clan Influencers Exit Over Contract Dispute With New Owner
items.standfirst: The future of the popular influencer group FaZe Clan is in flux once again after several members announced their departures this week following failed contract talks with new management.
items.content: The future of the popular influencer group FaZe Clan is in flux once again after several members announced their departures this week following failed contract talks with new management.

items.content: A bus plunged into a ravine along Guatemala’s Inter-American Highway, killing at least 15 people, authorities said.

items.title: Kennedy Center vows to sue musician who canceled performance over Trump name change
items.standfirst: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.
items.content: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.(Image credit: ‎)

items.content: Drummer Chuck Redd reportedly called off his Christmas Eve performance after a vote by the board to rename the site.

clusters.title: Yemen: 'The status quo is no longer feasible', analyst says
clusters.neutral_headline: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions

items.title: Yemen: 'The status quo is no longer feasible', analyst says
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia warned Saturday (December 27) it would back Yemen's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces and urged them to withdraw "peacefully" from recently-seized provinces. The statements came a day after reported Saudi air strikes on separatist positions in Yemen's Hadramawt province. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Liza Kaminov is joined by Mohammed Al-Basha, Founder of Basha Report, a US-based risk advisory firm.
items.content: Saudi Arabia warned Saturday (December 27) it would back Yemen's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces and urged them to withdraw "peacefully" from recently-seized provinces. The statements came a day after reported Saudi air strikes on separatist positions in Yemen's Hadramawt province. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Liza Kaminov is joined by Mohammed Al-Basha, Founder of Basha Report, a US-based risk advisory firm.

items.title: Saudi Arabia backs Yemen's government, urges separatists to withdraw from seized provinces
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia on Saturday said it would back Sanaa's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces in a statement that came a day after reported Saudi air strikes in Yemen's Hadramawt province.The Southern Transition Council (STC) separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates have recently made territorial gains, embarrassing regional heavyweight Saudi Arabia.
items.content: Saudi Arabia on Saturday said it would back Sanaa's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces in a statement that came a day after reported Saudi air strikes in Yemen's Hadramawt province.The Southern Transition Council (STC) separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates have recently made territorial gains, embarrassing regional heavyweight Saudi Arabia.

items.title: Yemeni separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of air strikes in eastern provinces
items.standfirst: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday (December 26) accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged.
items.content: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday (December 26) accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged.

items.title: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions
items.standfirst: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...
items.content: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire
clusters.neutral_headline: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia agreed to an "immediate" ceasefire on Saturday (December 26), the two countries said in a joint statement, pledging to end border clashes that killed dozens of people.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia agreed to an "immediate" ceasefire on Saturday (December 26), the two countries said in a joint statement, pledging to end border clashes that killed dozens of people.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree ‘immediate’ ceasefire after weeks of deadly border clashes
items.standfirst: Two countries pledge in joint statement to halt all forms of attacks and further troop deployments in long-running dispute over contested territoryThailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate” ceasefire, pledging to end weeks of deadly border clashes that have killed more than 100 people and displaced more than half a million on both sides.In a joint statement, the two south-east Asian neighbours said the ceasefire would take effect on Saturday at noon local time and involve “all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures, and military objectives of either side, in all cases and all areas”. Continue reading...
items.content: Two countries pledge in joint statement to halt all forms of attacks and further troop deployments in long-running dispute over contested territoryThailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate” ceasefire, pledging to end weeks of deadly border clashes that have killed more than 100 people and displaced more than half a million on both sides.In a joint statement, the two south-east Asian neighbours said the ceasefire would take effect on Saturday at noon local time and involve “all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures, and military objectives of either side, in all cases and all areas”. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Family cremates wrong body after hospital mistake
clusters.neutral_headline: Glasgow hospital launches inquiry after wrong body cremated

items.title: Family cremates wrong body after hospital mistake
items.standfirst: The Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow has apologised and launched an investigation.
items.content: The Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow has apologised and launched an investigation.

items.title: Glasgow hospital launches inquiry after wrong body cremated
items.standfirst: NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde apologises after error meant one family had no remains at a funeralAn investigation has been launched by a Glasgow hospital after an error led to the wrong body being cremated.The mistaken release of the body by the hospital to the undertakers was only discovered after the funeral service and the cremation had taken place. Continue reading...
items.content: NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde apologises after error meant one family had no remains at a funeralAn investigation has been launched by a Glasgow hospital after an error led to the wrong body being cremated.The mistaken release of the body by the hospital to the undertakers was only discovered after the funeral service and the cremation had taken place. items.title: Two killed in suspected Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
items.standfirst: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.
items.content: Police say the attacker, from the occupied West Bank, ran over at least one person before stabbing another victim several miles away.

items.title: Two killed in stabbing and suspected car-ramming in northern Israel
items.standfirst: Defence minister instructs military to respond with force in West Bank, where he said attacker was fromA Palestinian motorist ran over a man and stabbed a woman in northern Israel, killing both, Israeli emergency services say.The assailant, from the occupied West Bank, was shot and wounded by a civilian at the scene on Friday and taken to hospital, Israeli police said. Continue reading...
